questions.q: Would you consider yourself a people person?
How do you earn a potential client's trust?
Do you have any experience dealing with customer complaints?
What do you do in your free time?
How well do you deal with authority?
How do you measure the quality of the work you do?
What kind of sales tactics do you use?
How do you win over a client in the face of fierce competition?
How do you behave around clients?

answers.correct: Everyone who meets me loves me
I quickly establish a rapport with my clients.
I deal with them in a calming manner and work to resolve their issues.
I like to rest and relax so I'm ready for work the next day.
I respect good management and follow directions.
I am highly motivated by a competitive salary.
I'm very introspective and critical of my own work.
I appeal to the client's emotions to persuade them.
I appeal to the client's interests and needs to sway them.
I have a thirst for knowledge and stay up to date on current events.

bad_answers.translation: You didn't like those plants at reception, did you?
Don't blame me for your problems...
I hope you didn't want that sandwich in the fridge.
I have some unhealthy habits but I'm resourceful.
Can I see your shoes for just a second?
I see you left some snacks in the trash. Can I have them?

positive_responses: Your colleagues will be pleased to hear this
Of course, we like to slip a basic question in to test candidates
negative_responses: Is this some kind of joke?
Perhaps this isn't the right role for you
